data.title: Shirley Chisholm: Unbossed & Unbowed
data.meta_description: ﻿ Unbossed & Unbowed is an immersive and interactive solo show about the 1st African-American woman to run for the Presidency of the U.S. In the 1960s
data.text:
SAG/AFTRA; DRAMATISTS GUILD

Ingrid Griffith is a New York City based actor and the creator and performer of Shirley Chisholm: Unbossed & Unbowed, a one-woman show about the life and times of the political pioneer/social justice activist, Shirley Anita (St. Hill) Chisholm.

Ingrid has been touring “Unbossed & Unbowed” across the country. She is determined that Shirley Chisholm’s message of the importance of community, political involvement and personal initiative reaches audiences of all ages, especially Shirley Chisholm’s Brooklyn community and especially in this election year. Unbossed & Unbowed is a grass roots effort

that relies on organizations aligned with Shirley Chisholm’s vision to bring about positive change and Ingrid is thankful to the team at BRIC for making today’s event happen!

Ingrid Griffith’s one-woman show, Shirley Chisholm: Unbossed & Unbowed, won Outstanding Playwriting Award at the Hear Her Call Caribbean American Women’s Playwriting Festival (2020). She received a Danny Glover Power of Dream Award (2022), a Guyana Cultural Award for her work’s originality, scope, impact, influence, and her pioneering spirit (2023). Shirley Chisholm: Unbossed & Unbowed won the Suzi Bass Award for Outstanding Production about Social Justice (produced by Out of Hand Theater in Atlanta, GA) and Ingrid Griffith was

Nominated Outstanding Principal Performer in a Play (2023).
